# Measurement.FormatStyle

**Structure**

A type that provides localized representations of measurements.

## Declaration

```swift
struct FormatStyle
```

## Overview

A measurement format style creates human-readable text from a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement]. You can customize the formatting behavior of the format style using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/width], `numberFormat`, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/usage], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle/locale] properties. The system automatically caches unique configurations of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/FormatStyle] to enhance performance.

Use either the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/formatted()] or the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/formatted(_:)] instance method of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement] to create a string representation of a measurement.

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/formatted()] method generates a string using the default measurement format style.

```swift
let temperature = Measurement<UnitTemperature>(value: 38, unit: .celsius)
temperature.formatted()
// For locale: en_US: 100°F
// For locale: fr_FR: 38°C
```

The default format style in the previous example abbreviates the measurement unit. To customize any of the properties of the formatted measurement, you provide a measurement format style to the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/formatted(_:)] method. For example, to create a string with the full name of the unit, the code might resemble the following:

```swift
temperature.formatted(.measurement(width: .wide))
// For locale: en_US: 100 degrees Fahrenheit
// For locale: fr_FR: 38 degrés Celsius
```

The previous example uses a static factory method to create a measurement format style within the call to the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement/formatted(_:)] method. You can also create a measurement format style and pass it to the method, such as in the following example:

```swift
let distance = Measurement<UnitLength>(value: 36, unit: .miles)
let distanceStyle = Measurement<UnitLength>.FormatStyle(width: .wide, usage: .road)
distanceStyle.format(distance)
// for locale: en_US: 36 miles
// for locale: fr_FR: 58 kilomètres

```

After you create an instance of a format style, you can use it to format measurements of the same unit type.

## Creating a measurement format style

- **init(width:locale:usage:numberFormatStyle:)**: Creates an instance using the provided width, locale, usage type, and number format.
- **init(width:locale:usage:hidesScaleName:numberFormatStyle:)**: Creates an instance using the provided width, locale, usage type, number format, and the option to hide the unit name.

## Modifying a measurement format style

- **width**: The width of the measurement unit.
- **Measurement.FormatStyle.UnitWidth**: Specifies the width of the unit, determining the textual representation.
- **numberFormatStyle**: The formatting of the measurement value.
- **usage**: The intended purpose of the formatted measurement.
- **hidesScaleName**: The visibility of the unit name of a temperature.
- **locale**: The locale of the format style.

## Inspecting a measurement format style

- **attributed**: The attributed style for the measurement format style.

## Applying byte count styles

- **Measurement.FormatStyle.ByteCount**: A format style that provides string representations of byte counts, expressed as measurements of information storage.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- FormatStyle
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
